alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:21PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Sussex, northern Warren and east central Monroe Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Echo Lake, or 14 miles west of Newton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Hopatcong, Blairstown, Hope, Andover, Flatbrookville, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Werry Lake, Greendell, Millbrook, Five Points, Crandon Lakes, Echo Lake, Great Meadows-Vienna, Shawnee, Marshalls Creek and Hidden Lake. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and northeastern Pennsylvania.
